arch:property.oc:show_val: Locus 6 is ashy fill abutting a wall, L7, with lots of pebbles, mudbrick slump and burned and baked clay chunks. We dug this area as a fill then began to dig it as a pit and found out that it was much bigger than expected and more mixed. Digging this locus did not mix any contexts it just quickened the process of digging it. We eventually divided the section in half and came down in sections 10cm at a time. We sifted most of the locus and found 3 very nice small finds, see KT list. Split the locus between L8 and L9 when the differences between the hard mudbrick debris areas and the soft ashy areas were more defined.
ashy fine grain fill very loose
small pebbles, very burned pottery, mudbrick material, clay clumps baked or burned, small charcoal bits
this is ashy fill beside a mudbrick wall, very ashy in the section along west baulk but more mixed with mudbrick slump towards east baulk.

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

oc:metadata.dc:title: Kenan Tepe: Area A / Trench 9 / Locus 6 (Locus)
